meanings.definition: A type of academic cap worn during graduation ceremonies.
meanings.sent1: During the graduation ceremony, all the students wore mortarboards.
meanings.sent2: The graduates tossed their mortarboards in the air to celebrate.
meanings.sent3: The mortarboards made the students look very scholarly.
meanings.sent4: The sea of mortarboards created a colorful wave in the air.
meanings.sent5: The shiny tassel on the mortarboards swayed as the graduates walked.

meanings.definition: A flat, square board used for holding mortar in masonry work.
meanings.sent1: The mason placed the mortar on the mortarboards before applying it to the wall.
meanings.sent2: The workers carried the heavy mortarboards to the construction site.
meanings.sent3: The playful cat decided to nap on the warm mortarboards.
meanings.sent4: The old mortarboards had seen many buildings rise and fall.
meanings.sent5: The rough texture of the mortarboards helped grip the mortar in place.
